Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Navigation class, most of the action method for this robot is defined here.
    Author:
    George Kandalaft, Han Zhou

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Navigation​()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static int convertAngle​(double angle)
      Converts input angle to the total rotation of each wheel needed to rotate the robot by that angle.
      static int convertDistance​(double distance)
      Converts input distance to the total rotation of each wheel needed to cover that distance.
      static void directDrive​(double dist)
      dirve without interruption, regardless of the current position will not travel expect distance due to the heavy load.
      static void directTurn​(double angle)
      turn without interruption, regardless of the current heading will not turn expected angle due to the heavy load.
      static double getDestAngle​(double x, double y)
      calculated the closest angle from position to destination
      static double getDestDist​(double x, double y)
      calculate the distance from target point to the current local position
      static void modeTravel​(boolean forward)
      make robot keep going in one direction
      static void modeTurn​(boolean clockwise)
      make robot keep turning in one direction, will turn clockwise if clockwise is true
      static void setSpeeds​(float leftSpeed, float rightSpeed)
      setSpeeds for two wheels, support negative values
      static void travelTo​(double x, double y)
      travel to a destination point, will keep adjust heading during travel, this may cause some trouble since adjusting head may not work so easily as the load is high
      static void turnTo​(double angle)
      Most reliable turn function, will turn to the degrees regards to the odometer
